    Find the intersection in the color space of the two images passed as arguments and returns a hashtable The hashtable contains all the location of the pixel for each color, these location depend on the image thus, specify which image the location should be used

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

    • clusterTo

      public static void clusterTo​(set.Set s, double threshold)
      Calls the private method in charge of the clustering depending on the SetType of the set gicen in parameter
      Parameters:
      s - the set that must be clustered
      threshold - the value defining the recursivity of the set

    • clusterWithFrequencyTo

      public static void clusterWithFrequencyTo​(set.Set s, double threshold)
      Call the private method in charge of clustering with additional condition on the frequency of each color, depending on the type of set (only support RGB set atm)
      Parameters:
      s - the set that must be clustered
      threshold - the value defining the recursivity of the set

    • expectedSetinRGB

      public static set.Point expectedSetinRGB​(set.Set s)
      Calls the private method responsible for finding the expected color, depends on the SetType of the set passed as argument
      Parameters:
      s - the set for which we want the expected color
      Returns:
      the Point representing the expected color

    • varianceSetinRGB

      public static set.Point varianceSetinRGB​(set.Set s)
      Calls the private method responsible for finding the variance of the color, depends on the SetType of the set passed as argument
      Parameters:
      s - the set for which we want the variance of the color
      Returns:
      the Point representing the variance of the color

    • intersectIMG

      public static int[][] intersectIMG​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bimg1, java.awt.image.BufferedImage bimg2, boolean onFirstImg)
      Find the intersection in the color space of the two images passed as arguments and returns a hashtable The hashtable contains all the location of the pixel for each color, these location depend on the image thus, specify which image the location should be used
      Parameters:
      bimg1 -
      bimg2 -
      onFirstImg - true; the hashtable will contains the location of the color on the first image, false; the hashtable will contains the location of the color on the first image
      Returns:
      hashtable (int[][]) containing the intersection with array location depending on the value of param onFirstImg

    • SettoIMG

      public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage SettoIMG​(set.Set s)
      The method calls the private method for turning the set into an image depending on the SetType of the set passed as argument
      Parameters:
      s - the set for which we want to get the image
      Returns:
      a bufferedimage of the set

    • IMGtoShash

      public static int[][] IMGtoShash​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bimg)
      transform an image into an hashtable[][] for which the index are the hashcode of the color and the array associated the location in the image of each color
      Parameters:
      bimg - bufferedimage to be made into a hashtable
      Returns:
      a hastable

    • shashtoIMG

      public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage shashtoIMG​(int[][] shash, int W, int H)
      Turns a hashtable into an image
      Parameters:
      shash - the hashtable contains the location of each color in the image
      W - the width of the image
      H - the height of the image
      Returns:
      the image of the hashtable

    • findHighestFrequency

      public static set.Point findHighestFrequency​(int[][] shash, int W)
      Parameters:
      shash - the hashtable to be parsed
      W - the width of the image associated with the hashtable
      Returns:
      the Color with the highest frequency
